{{Infobox yoga school |name=Agni Yoga |color= |bgcolor= |religious_origins= |regional_origins= |founding_gurus=[[Helena Roerich]] and [[Nicholas Roerich]] |popularity=Growing from the 20th century |derivatives= |related_schools=[[Theosophy (Blavatskian)]] |practice_emphases=''Conscious striving in one's daily life'' |other_topics= }} [[Image:Pax cultura.svg |right||thumb|Roerichs [[Banner of Peace]] as the symbol of protection of Culture.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/museum/layout/banner/03.php |title=The Banner of Peace became famous on the planet as the symbol of protection of Culture |publisher=International Centre of the Roerichs |accessdate=21 November 2018 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/746JYBPJ4 |archivedate=21 November 2018}}]] '''Agni Yoga''' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: ''Агни Йога'') or the '''Living Ethics''' (Russian: ''Жива́я Этика''), or the '''Teaching of Life''' (Russian: ''Учение Жизни'') is a one of the [[Neo-Theosophy|neo-theosophical]] [[religious doctrine]] transmitted by the [[Helena Roerich]] and [[Nicholas Roerich]] from 1920. The term ''Agni Yoga'' means “Mergence with Divine Fire” or “Path to Mergence with Divine Fire”. This term was introduced by the Roerichs. The followers of Agni Yoga believe that the teaching was given to the Roerich family and their associates by [[Masters of the Ancient Wisdom|Master]] [[Morya (Theosophy)|Morya]], the [[guru]] of Roerichs and [[Helena Blavatsky]], one of the founders of the modern theosophical movement and the [[Theosophical Society]]. Agni Yoga is a path of practice in daily life. It is the [[yoga]] of fiery energy, of consciousness, of responsible, directed thought. It teaches that the evolution of the [[planetary consciousness]] is a pressing necessity and that, through [[Individual#Buddhism|individual]] striving, it is an attainable aspiration for mankind. According to Helena Roerich, Agni Yoga is the [[Thesis, antithesis, synthesis|synthesis]] of all [[yoga]]s. In all the [[List of Hindu texts|ancient Hindu scriptures]], the approaching Fiery Age was predicted. Agni-Fire, which to a varying degree is at the heart of all the yogas, will extremely sate the atmosphere of our planet, and all the branches of Yoga will be merged into a fiery synthesis. Agni Yoga is a fire [[baptism]]. The most significant features of Agni Yoga are cosmism and [[universalism]]. They are expressed in the interpretation of any phenomena of human existence from the point of view of their cosmic significance and interrelation with the being of the [[Universe]]. Agni Yoga played a significant role in bringing knowledge of [[Asian religions]] to [[Western world]]. Living Ethics has an international following and has thousands of adherents. The ideas of Teaching of Life have exerted an influence on another [[esoteric]] movements and philosophies, among them the [[New Age]] and [[Transhumanism]]. ==Birth of the new religion== {{double image |right|Helena Roerich (V. Serov).jpg |170 |HPB by Schmiechen.jpg |171 |Two women had a strong influence on the creation of the religious doctrine of Agni yoga, [[Helena Roerich]] by [[Valentin Serov|Serov]] (left) and [[Helena Blavatsky]] by [[:de:Hermann Schmiechen|Schmiechen]]}} ===Etymology and concept=== The term ''Agni Yoga'' means “Mergence with Divine Fire” or “Path to Mergence with Divine Fire”. This term was introduced to the western public by the [[Nicholas Roerich]] and [[Helena Roerich]].{{cite web |url=http://www.highest-yoga.info/en/yoga/agni-yoga.html |title=Agni Yoga |publisher=highest-yoga.info |accessdate=21 November 2018 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/746J1WitJ |archivedate=21 November 2018}} ''[[Agni]]'' ({{lang-sa|अग्नि}}) is the [[Vedas|Vedic]] and Living Ethics ''God of Fire'', one marks immortality and the symbol of life. Agni is one of the supreme gods in the [[Rigveda]]. In Agni Yoga it is the Creative Fire of the Universe, the root of the "Fire of Space"; and "psychic energy", the powers of the human mind and heart, particularly those manifesting in love, thought, and creativity.{{cite web |url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/world-religions/oclc/659908115?ht=edition&referer=null |author=[[John Bowker (theologian)|Bowker, John]] |title=World Religions |publisher=New York: DK Publishing, Inc. |accessdate=10 September 2018 |year=1997 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wJMDtNzh?url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/world-religions/oclc/659908115?ht=edition&referer=null |archivedate=8 January 2018 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}} The origin myth found in many [[Indo-European culture]]s Agni is a bird like being, that brings fire from the gods to mankind. Alternatively, this messenger brings an elixir of immortality from heaven to [[Earth]]. In the early [[Vedic literature]], Agni primarily connotes the fire as a god, one reflecting the primordial powers to consume, transform and convey.{{cite book |author=Arthur Anthony Macdonell |title=Vedic Mythology |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=b7Meabtj8mcC |year=1898 |publisher=Motilal Banarsidass |isbn=978-81-208-1113-3 |pages=15–16, 92–93 |accessdate=27 October 2018}} ''[[Yoga]]'' ({{lang-sa|योग}}; {{pronunciation|Yoga pronunciation.ogg |help=no}}) is one of the six orthodox schools of [[Hindu philosophy]]. There is a broad variety of yoga schools, practices, and goals in [[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]], and [[Jainism]]. Yoga is a group of [[soul|spiritual]], [[mind|mental]], and [[Human body|physical]] practices or disciplines which originated in [[ancient India]]. The term ''Yoga'' has been applied to a variety of practices and methods. In Hinduism these include [[Jnana yoga|Jnana Yoga]], [[Bhakti yoga|Bhakti Yoga]], [[Karma yoga|Karma Yoga]], [[Laya yoga|Laya Yoga]] and [[Hatha yoga|Hatha Yoga]]. The term ''[[Rāja yoga]]'' originally referred to the ultimate goal of yoga, which is [[Samadhi]] ([[Sanskrit]]: {{lang|sa|समाधि}}, {{IPA-hns|səˈmaːdʱi|hi}}), but was popularised by [[Swami Vivekananda]] as the common name for ''Ashtanga Yoga''. In the Ashtanga Yoga tradition, ''Samadhi'' is the eighth and final limb identified in the [[Yoga Sutras of Patanjali]].{{cite book |author=[[Georg Feuerstein]] |title=The Yoga Tradition: Its History, Literature, Philosophy and Practice |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=cI5XDwAAQBAJ |date=23 October 2012 |publisher=Hohm Press |isbn=978-1-935387-39-8 |page=37 |accessdate=10 September 2018}}{{cite book |url= http://www.universaltheosophy.com/pdf-library/Yoga%20Darshana%20Eng%20with%20Vyasa%20Bhashya%20&%20Notes%20-%20Ganganath%20Jha%201907.pdf |title=The Yoga-darsana: The sutras of Patanjali with the Bhasya of Vyasa - Book 3 GN Jha (Translator) |publisher=Harvard University Archives |pages=94-96 |accessdate=27 November 2018 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/74EpHxkeG |archivedate=27 November 2018}} {{Quote box |width = 25em |border = 3px |align = left |bgcolor = #D0F0C0 |fontsize = 99% |quote = Agni Yoga is a synthesis of all [[Yoga]]s. In all the ancient [[Hindu texts|Hindu scriptures]] the approaching Fiery Epoch has been predicted. It is said that [[Agni]]—the Fire that is found in varying degrees at the foundation of all Yogas will saturate the atmosphere of our planet tremendously, and all the branches of Yoga will be fused into a fiery synthesis. Verily, Agni Yoga is a fiery [[baptism]] |salign = left |source = —[[Helena Roerich]]{{cite book |url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Letters-of-Helena-Roerich-I.php |last=Roerich |first=Helena |year=1929-1935 |title=Letters of Helena Roerich |volume=1 |page=411 |publisher=agniyoga.org |accessdate=25 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6p2O3gT5L? |archivedate=17 March 2017}} }} ''[[Aum]]'' or ''Oṃ'' ([[Devanagari]]: {{script|Deva|'''ॐ'''}}), {{audio|Om pro.ogg|listen}}, is a sacred sound and a spiritual symbol in [[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]], and [[Jainism]]. This word has three [[phoneme]]s: ''a'', ''u'', and ''m'', though it is often described as [[trisyllabic]] despite this being either archaic or the result of translation.{{cite-book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=e89eDwAAQBAJ&pg=PT287&dq=%22om%22+%22three%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjWvpr3_8zcAhVDd6wKHehnCgIQ6AEIQzAF#v=onepage&q=%22om%22%20%22three%22&f=false |title=The Om Mala: Meanings of the Mystic Sound |publisher=Bloomsbury Publishing |isbn=9789387471856 |accessdate=13 November 2018}}{{cite-book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dLlIAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA61&dq=%22om%22+%22three%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjWvpr3_8zcAhVDd6wKHehnCgIQ6AEITzAH#v=onepage&q=%22om%22%20%22three%22&f=false |author=Vālmīki |year=1891 |title=The Yoga-vásishtha-mahárámáyana of Válmiki |volume=1 |page=61 |publisher=Bonnerjee and Company |accessdate=26 September 2018}} That signifies the essence of the ultimate reality, consciousness or [[Atman (Hinduism)|Atman]].{{cite-book |url=https://www.amazon.com/Illustrated-Encyclopedia-Hinduism-Vol-N-Z/dp/0823931803/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1538043614&sr=1-1 |author=James G Lochtefeld |title=The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Hinduism |year=2002| volume=2 N-Z |page=482 |publisher=Rosen Publishing |isbn=978-0823931804 |accessdate=27 September 2018}} The twelfth book of the [[Scriptures]] of Agni Yoga is called ''AUM''. Aum, as this book says, was a synthesis of sonant strivings. Prayer and inward concentration are excellent attainments which render healthful the state of the spirit. Each one in his own way has contributed a manifestation useful to spiritual concentration, whether he sought the solution in music, in song, or in the dance; man was striving to create a particularly exalted state of mind, promoting the reception of the higher energies.{{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Aum.php |title=Aum, §4 |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1936 |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ASzqsWl?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Aum.php |archivedate=14 October 2018}} ''Ur'' or ''[[Aditi]]'' ([[Sanskrit]]: अदिति "limitless"),From ''a-'' ([[privative a]]) and ''diti'' "bound," which is from the Proto Indo-European root *''da-'' "to bind." in the [[Vedas]] and Living Ethics is the Mother of the gods and all twelve zodiacal spirits from whose cosmic matrix the heavenly bodies were born. As celestial mother of every existing form and being, the synthesis of all things, she is associated with space and with mystic speech. She is mentioned nearly 80 times in the [[Rigveda]]: the verse "[[Daksha]] sprang from Aditi and Aditi from Daksha" is seen by Theosophists as a reference to "the eternal cyclic re-birth of the same divine Essence" and divine wisdom.{{cite web |url=http://www.theosociety.org/pasadena/etgloss/adi-ag.htm |title=Adi-Ag: Encyclopedic Theosophical Glossary |publisher=Theosociety.org |accessdate=4 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73fwLSZQ7?url=https://www.theosociety.org/pasadena/etgloss/adi-ag.htm |archivedate=4 November 2018}} "Ur is the root of the Light of Fire", it is stated in the [[holy writ]] of Agni Yoga.{{cite web |url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Fiery-World-I.php |title=Fiery World Part I Preface |publisher=agniyoga.org |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ATDKnlB?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Fiery-World-I.php |archivedate=14 October 2018}} ''[[Shambhala]]'' ({{lang-sa|शम्भलः}}, {{bo|t=བདེ་འབྱུང}};) is a birthplace of [[Kalki]], the final incarnation of [[Vishnu]], who will usher in a New Age — [[Satya Yuga]]. Shambhala is ruled over by [[Maitreya]].{{cite web |url=https://docviewer.yandex.ru/view/94772562/?*=pJNhApHCEiN8vf%2FRWPuXaI3zG%%3D&page=1 |title=Maitreya |year=2006 |publisher=Agni Yoga Society |accessdate=23 September 2018}} The [[Kalacakra Tantra]] prophesies that when all is lost, Kalki will emerge from Shambhala to vanquish "Dark Forces" and usher in a worldwide [[Golden Age]]. Shambhala is also called [[Shangri-la]].{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oUIum8H_9qgC |last=LePage |first=Victoria| title=Shambhala: The Fascinating Truth Behind the Myth of Shangri-La |year=1996 |publisher=Quest Books |pages=125–126 |isbn=9780835607506 |accessdate=18 September 2018}} [[File:Moryaportrait.jpg |thumb |240 px |right |[[Morya (Theosophy)|Master Morya]] by [[:de:Hermann Schmiechen|Hermann Schmiechen]], 1884.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=74jEiVAhVHEC&pg=PA142#v=onepage&q&f=false |author=Sarah Diane Sasson |title=Yearning for the New Age: Laura Holloway-Langford and Late Victorian Spirituality (Religion in North America) |publisher=[[Indiana University Press]] |year=2012 |pages=142—144 |isbn=9780253001771 |accessdate=27 September 2018}}
«Hermann Schmiechen was a German painter living in London who had joined the Theosophical Society. He agreed to take part in a ''psychical experiment'' to see if images could be transferred to his mind from those who had seen the Masters...»]] ''[[Morya (Theosophy)|Morya]]'' is one of the [[Masters of the Ancient Wisdom]] within modern Theosophical beliefs.{{cite book |last2=[[:cv:Ауновская Ольга Константиновна |Aunovsky]] |first2=O. K. |last1=[[Victor Skumin|Skumin]] |first1=V. A. |year=1995 |script-title=ru: Светоносцы (о семье Рерихов) |trans-title=The Bringers of the Light (The story of the Roerich family) |location=[[Novocheboksarsk]] |publisher=TEROS |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/svet.html |isbn=5-88167-004-3 |language=Russian |accessdate=10 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6t3vBmhIG? |archivedate=28 August 2017 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}} He is one of the [[Mahatmas]] who inspired the founding of the Theosophy and Agni Yoga.{{cite web |url=https://sirius-eng.net/liki/moria.htm |title=Master Morya |publisher=sirius-eng.net |accessdate=17 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wJLsG9R7?|archivedate=8 January 2018}} He has written and dictated the letters with the goal of elevating mankind and bringing in a New Age.{{cite web |url=http://www.reversespins.com/agninewera.html |title=El Morya on Prophecy, the New Era and the Age of Maitreya |publisher=Reverse Spins |accessdate=4 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73fwqCfmS?url=http://www.reversespins.com/agninewera.html |archivedate=4 November 2018}} The Master Morya will physically incarnate in order to be the [[Manu (Theosophy)|Manu]] ("progenitor") of the new [[Root race#The sixth root race|root race]].{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=Victor |script-title=ru: Гимны Культуры Здоровья |trans-title=Gimns of Culture of Health |year=2007 |location=[[Cheboksary]] |publisher=To Health via Culture |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/gimn.html |language=Russian |isbn=978-5-88167-030-6 |accessdate=27 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmcoqT4R?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/gimn.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}}[[Annie Besant|Besant]]/[[Charles Webster Leadbeater|Leadbeater]], [[Man: Whence, How and Whither, a Record of Clairvoyant Investigation|''Man: How, Whence, and Whither?'', p. 353-495]]. ''[[Tara (Buddhism)|Tara]] Urusvati'' (''The Light of the Morning Star'') is the spiritual name of [[Helena Roerich]] (1879 – 1955) in Agni Yoga and [[Rerikhism]].{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=V. A. |script-title=ru: Афоризмы Агни Йоги |trans-title=Sutras of Agni Yoga |year=1995 |location=Novocheboksarsk |publisher=Teros |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/af.html |language=Russian |isbn=5-88167-007-8 |accessdate=12 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wIUCotb1?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/af.html |archivedate=7 January 2018 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}} She was a teacher and healer as well as the inspired co-author of the ''Agni Yoga series'', the first English books about Living Ethics and the Roerichs' relationship with their Guru.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ru/books/about/Nicholas_and_Helena_Roerich.html?id=YltbBgAAQBAJ&redir_esc=y |last=Drayer |first=Ruth Abrams |year=2014 |title=Nicholas & Helena Roerich: The Spiritual Journey of Two Great Artists & Peacemakers |isbn=9780835631143 |publisher=Quest Books |origyear=2005 |page=309 |accessdate=10 September 2018}} Each of the 935 paragraphs of the book "Supermundane" begins with the word "Urusvati".{{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Supermundane.php |title=Supermundane |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1938 |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ATQDcyS?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Supermundane.php |archivedate=14 October 2018}} In the epilogue of the book "Agni Yoga" she was called the Mother of Agni Yoga.{{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Agni-Yoga.php |title=Agni yoga Epilogue |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1929 |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ATcf7iT?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Agni-Yoga.php |archivedate=14 October 2018}} ''Fuyama'' is the spiritual name of [[Nicholas Roerich]] (1874 – 1947) in Agni Yoga and Rerikhism. He was an internationally acclaimed artist, conservationist, archeologist, humanitarian and peacemaker.{{cite journal |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/j10_2.html |title=Фуяма — огненный Гуру-Покровитель духовного человечества |trans-title=Fuyama (N. Roerich's spiritual name) is a Fiery Guru-patron of spiritual humanity |author=Skumin VA |year=2004 |journal=To Health via Culture |volume=10 |pages=31–34 |issn=0204-3440 |accessdate=21 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmbpbde2?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/j10_2.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}} Nicolas Roerich called Urusvati “She Who Leads” in his creations.{{cite web |url=http://irmtkullu.com/the-roerich-family/helena-roerich/ |title=Helena Ivanovna Roerich (1879 – 1955) |publisher=irmtkullu.com |accessdate=4 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73fxVWJee?url=http://irmtkullu.com/the-roerich-family/helena-roerich/ |archivedate=4 November 2018}} ''[[Karma]]'' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|ɑr|m|ə}}; {{lang-sa|कर्म|karma}}, {{IPA-sa|ˈkərmə|IPA|Karma.ogg}}) means action, work or deed. It also refers to the spiritual principle of cause and effect where intent and actions of an individual influence his future. Good intent and good deeds contribute to good karma and future happiness, while bad intent and bad deeds contribute to bad karma and future suffering. With origins in [[History of India|ancient India]]'s [[Vedic civilization]], the philosophy of karma is closely associated with the idea of [[Reincarnation|rebirth]] in many schools of [[Indian religions]], particularly [[Karma in Hinduism|Hinduism]], [[Karma in Buddhism|Buddhism]], [[Karma in Jainism|Jainism]] and [[Sikhism]].{{cite book |author=Parvesh Singla |title=The Manual of Life – Karma |year=2002 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1mXR35jX-TsC&pg=PP5 |publisher=books.google.com |pages=5–7 |accessdate=17 October 2018}} Karma works as one of the great principles of Cosmic Action. ''When man realizes the power of karma and strives to express the best aspirations, his path is parallel with the universal energy. The universal energy attracts the creative strivings. The future and the Infinite are thus being built'', written in the Holy Scripture of Agni Yoga.{{cite book |url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Infinity-II.php |title=Infinity Part II, 159 |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1930 |accessdate=21 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73L93b1d9?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Infinity-II.php |archivedate=21 October 2018}} ''[[Spiritual evolution]]'' is the [[philosophy|philosophical]], [[theology|theological]], [[Esoteric knowledge|esoteric]] or [[Spirituality|spiritual]] idea that nature and human beings and [[human culture]] evolve: either extending from an established [[esoteric cosmology|cosmological]] [[pattern]] (ascent), or in accordance with certain pre-established potentials.{{YouTube |GbWMw249xY8 |The Hidden History of Humanity}} The phrase "spiritual evolution" can occur in the context of ''higher evolution'', a term used to differentiate psychological, mental, or spiritual evolution from the ''lower evolution'' or [[biological evolution]] of physical form. {{cite book | last1 = Piyasīlo | first1 = | author-link1 = Piya Tan | title = The Buddha's teachings: a study of comparative Buddhism in truth, tradition & transformation | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=dKMEAQAAIAAJ | series = Dharmafarer integrated syllabus series | issue = 4 | edition = 2 | publisher = Dharmafarer Enterprises | publication-date = 1991 | page = 130 | isbn = 9789839030013 | accessdate = 27 September 2018 | quote = The instrument of this growth is the Dharma which is the path of the Higher Evolution. The term 'Higher' here refers to the mind - the basis of spiritual evolution. In contrast to the Higher Evolution, the biological (or Darwinian) evolution is known as the Lower Evolution. }} The concept of spiritual evolution is also complemented by the idea of a [[creative impulse]] in human beings, known as [[Epigenesis (biology)|epigenesis]]. {{cite book | last1 = Heindel | first1 = Max | author-link1 = Max Heindel | title = The Rosicrucian Philosophy in Questions and Answers | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=ozFDAAAAIAAJ | publisher = Rosicrucian Fellowship | publication-date = 1922 | edition = 3 | page = 10 | accessdate = 27 September 2018 | quote = Since the mind was given to man, it is this original creative impulse, epigenesis, which has been the cause of all our development[...] }} ''Agni Yoga'', in general, is a neo-theosophical religious doctrine{{cite web |url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=EZYsPQgBNioC&pg=PA103#v=onepage&q&f=false |title=Claiming Knowledge: Strategies of Epistemology from Theosophy to the New Age |publisher=books.google.ru |isbn=9789004136380 |accessdate=14 September 2018}} transmitted by the Helena and Nicholas Roerichs from 1920. The followers of ''Living Ethics'' believe that the teaching was given to the Roerichs' family{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/family/ |title=Roerichs' family |publisher=International Centre of the Roerichs |accessdate=5 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73hG4fIF5?url=http://en.icr.su/family/ |archivedate=5 November 2018}} and their associates by Master Morya, the guru of Roerichs and Helena Blavatsky, one of the founders of the modern theosophical movement and the Theosophical Society.{{cite web |url=http://www.katinkahesselink.net/path6.htm |title=The Esoteric Studies Guide |publisher=katinkahesselink.net |accessdate=5 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73hGKLp2d?url=http://www.katinkahesselink.net/path6.htm |archivedate=5 November 2018}} ''Teaching of Life'' is a path of practice in daily life. It is the yoga of fiery energy, of consciousness, of responsible, directed thought. It teaches that the evolution of the [[planetary consciousness]] is a pressing necessity and that, through individual striving, it is an attainable aspiration for mankind.{{cite web |url=http://www.agniyoga.org/ay_info.html |title=About Agni Yoga |publisher=agniyoga.org |accessdate=8 September 2018 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/65YcI6cTu?url=http://www.agniyoga.org/ay_info.html |archive-date=19 February 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} The most significant features of Agni Yoga are cosmism and universalism. They are expressed in the interpretation of any phenomena of human existence from the point of view of their cosmic significance and interrelation with the being of the Universe.{{cite book |last=Samokhina |first=N. E. |script-title=ru: Проблема человека в Агни-Йоге. Автореф. дисс. на соиск. уч. ст. канд. философ. наук |trans-title=The problem of man in Agni Yoga. Thesis for the degree of candidate of philosophical sciences |url=http://cheloveknauka.com/v/401041/a#?page=3 |year=1994 |pages=3-4 |language=Russian |publisher=[[Moscow State University]] |accessdate=5 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73hH1oQtD?url=http://cheloveknauka.com/problema-cheloveka-v-agni-yoge |archivedate=5 November 2018}} ===Precursors of Agni Yoga=== [[File:Leo Tolstoy The Voice of the Silence.jpg |240 px |thumb |''[[The Voice of the Silence]]'' presented by Helena Blavatsky to [[Leo Tolstoy]] ([[Yasnaya Polyana]], a [[writer's home]]).]] ====Theosophy==== {{Main|Theosophy (Blavatskian)}} The [[Theosophical Society]] was officially formed in [[New York City]] on 17 November 1875 by [[Helena Blavatsky]], [[Henry Steel Olcott]], [[William Quan Judge]], and others. It was self-described as "an unsectarian body of seekers after Truth, who endeavour to promote Brotherhood and strive to serve humanity." After a few years Olcott and Blavatsky moved to India and established the International Headquarters at [[Theosophical Society Adyar|Adyar]], in [[Chennai|Madras]].{{cite book |url=https://books.google.de/books/about/The_Theosophical_Movement.html?id=OC4IAQAAIAAJ&redir_esc=y |year=1951 |title=The Theosophical Movement 1875–1950 |publisher=Cunningham Press |location=Los Angeles |accessdate=26 September 2018}} Madame Blavatsky (''Upasica'' - this spiritual name means a female lay disciple. So the ''Teachers'' called [[Helena Petrovna Blavatsky|HPB]]{{cite book| title=Theosophy and culture: Nicholas Roerich |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=AdpG8sGt8K8C&printsec=frontcover&hl=ru&source=gbs_atb#v=onepage&q&f=false |author=Stasulane, Anita |publisher=Gregorian Biblical BookShop |location=Rome |volume=8 |year=2005 |page=26-27 |isbn=978-88-7839-035-5 |accessdate=16 October 2018}}), the greatest [[occultist]] in the history of [[Western civilization]], insisted that [[Theosophy (Blavatskian)|Theosophy]] is not a [[religion]], although did refer to it as the modern transmission of the "once universal religion" that she claimed had existed deep into the human past. The motto of the Theosophical movement: '''There is no Religion higher than Truth'''.{{cite journal |url=http://www.ultindia.org/tm_magazine/TMOct2018.pdf |title=The motto is located at the top of the magazine page |journal=The Theosophical Movement. A Magazine Devoted to The Living of the Higher Life |year=2018 |volume=10 |issue=6 |publisher=Theosopy Company ([[India]], [[Mumbai]]) Private LTD |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qpmiLML?url=http://www.ultindia.org/tm_magazine/TMOct2018.pdf |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Theosophical organisations, regard it as a system that embraces what they see as the "essential truth" underlying religion, philosophy, and science. Theosophical groups allow their members to hold other religious allegiances, resulting in [[Theosophists]] who also identify as [[Christians]], [[Buddhists]], or [[Hindus]].{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ru/books/about/Is_Theosophy_a_Religion.html?id=2Kd5ngEACAAJ&source=kp_cover&redir_esc=y |last=Blavatsky |first=Helena |year=2013 |title=Is Theosophy a Religion? |pages=24 |isbn=9781258977719 |accessdate=10 September 2018}} The term [[Neo-Theosophy]] was coined by Ferdinand T. Brooks around 1912. This term used by the followers of Helena Blavatsky to denominate the system of theosophical ideas expounded following the death of Blavatsky in 1891. This material differed in major respects from Blavatsky's original presentation, but it is accepted as genuinely theosophical by many theosophists around the world.{{cite book |url=http://www.blavatskyarchives.com/thomas/ |title=Theosophy Versus Neo-Theosophy: Margaret Thomas' Study of C. W. Leadbeater's and Annie Besant's Theosophical Teachings |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jORxNRh?url=http://www.blavatskyarchives.com/thomas/ |archivedate=6 November 2018}} Daryl S. Paulson associates "Neo-Theosophy" with [[Alice Bailey]].{{cite journal |url=https://digital.library.unt.edu/ark:/67531/metadc799372/ |first=Daryl S. |last=Paulson |title=The Near-Death Experience: An Integration of Cultural, Spiritual, and Physical Perspectives |journal=Journal of Near-Death Studies |publisher=New York, N.Y.: Human Sciences Press |volume=18 |number=1 |year=1999 |pages=13-25 |issn=0891-4494 |oclc=14781775 |accessdate=5 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73hsZ4WWX?url=https://digital.library.unt.edu/ark:/67531/metadc799372/ |archivedate=5 November 2018}} She introduced the term [[New Age]] – [[Age of Aquarius]].{{cite book |url=https://www.gettextbooks.co.uk/isbn/9780853301059/ |last=Bailey |first=Alice A. |year=2012 |title=Education in the New Age |pages=174 |publisher=gettextbooks.co.uk |isbn=978-0853301059 |accessdate=5 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73hrBsq4y?url=https://www.gettextbooks.co.uk/isbn/9780853301059/ |archivedate=5 November 2018}} Other neo-theosophists include [[Rudolf Steiner]]'s contemporary [[Peter Deunov]] and [[Samael Aun Weor]]. [[Dion Fortune]] and [[Aleister Crowley]] were also influencers of the leading edge of the theosophical movement. Some examples of neo-theosophists today include [[Benjamin Creme]]{{cite book| url=http://share-international.org/books/PDFs/BCreme_TransmissionAMeditationForTheNewAge_Jun06.pdf |author=[[Benjamin Creme]] |title=Transmission A meditation for the New Age |publisher=share-international.org |accessdate=5 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73hqv2NN3?url=http://share-international.org/books/PDFs/BCreme_TransmissionAMeditationForTheNewAge_Jun06.pdf |archivedate=5 November 2018}} and [[Victor Skumin]]. So, in 1990, Skumin, based on the theosophical concept of [[spiritual evolution]], proposed a classification of '''Homo spiritalis''' ([[Latin]]: ''Spiritual man''), the sixth root race, consisting of eight sub-races (subspecies): ''HS-0'' Anabiosis spiritalis, ''HS-1'' Scientella spiritalis, ''HS-2'' Aurora spiritalis, ''HS-3'' Ascensus spiritalis, ''HS-4'' Vocatus spiritalis, ''HS-5'' Illuminatio spiritalis, ''НS-6'' Creatio spiritalis, and ''HS-7'' Servitus spiritalis.{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=V. A. |script-title=ru:Человек духовный: роль культуры духовного здоровья в утверждении новой человеческой расы на планете |trans-title=Spiritual man: The role of the Culture of spiritual health for approval of the new human race on the planet |year=1996 |publisher=theeuropeanlibrary.org |url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/3000010564370?query=%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%BA%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80+%D1%81%D0%BA%D1%83%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BD+ |language=Russian |isbn=5-88167-012-4 |accessdate=27 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6hDz04YV5?url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/3000010564370?query=%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%BA%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80+%D1%81%D0%BA%D1%83%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BD+ |archivedate=3 May 2016 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}} ====Russian philosophy and Russian Cosmism ==== {{Main|List of Russian philosophers|Russian Cosmism}} [[File:Vladimir Solovyov 1892 by Nikolay Yarochenko.jpg |180 px |thumb |left |[[Vladimir Solovyov (philosopher)|Vladimir Solovyov]] by [[Nikolai Yaroshenko]], 1892]] [[File:Pasternak fedorov.jpg |180 px |thumb |left |[[Nikolai Fyodorovich Fyodorov|Nikolai Fyodorov]] by [[Leonid Pasternak]]]] Russian [[philosophy]] as a separate entity started its development in the [[History of Russia (1892–1917)|19th century]], defined initially by the opposition of [[Westernizers]], advocating Russia's following the Western political and economical models, and [[Slavophiles]], insisting on developing [[Russia]] as a unique civilization. The latter group included [[Nikolai Danilevsky]] and [[Konstantin Leontiev]], the early founders of [[eurasianism]]. ''Slavophilia'' was an intellectual movement originating from 19th century that wanted the [[Russian Empire]] to be developed upon values and institutions derived from its early history. There were also similar movements in [[Bulgaria]], [[Croatia]], [[Czechoslovakia]], [[Poland]], and [[Serbia]]. Depending on the historical context, its opposite could be termed [[Slavophobia]], a fear of [[Slavic culture]].{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9068172/Slavophile |publisher=Encyclopædia Britannica |title=Slavophile Russian history |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jPhqyh2?url=https://www.britannica.com/topic/Slavophile |archivedate=6 November 2018}} The discussion of Russia's place in the world has since become the most characteristic feature of Russian philosophy. Notable philosophers of the late 19th and early 20th centuries include [[Vladimir Solovyov (philosopher)|Vladimir Solovyev]], [[Vasily Rozanov]], [[Lev Shestov]], [[Leo Tolstoy]], [[Sergei Bulgakov]], [[Pavel Florensky]], [[Pitirim Sorokin]].In its further development, Russian philosophy was also marked by deep connection to [[literature]] and interest in [[creativity]], [[society]], [[religion]], and [[Russian cosmism]].{{cite-book |url=https://www.amazon.com/Red-Cosmos-Tsiolkovskii-Grandfather-Centennial/dp/1603441174 |author=James T. Andrews |title=Red cosmos: K.E. Tsiolkovskii, grandfather of Soviet rocketry (Centennial of Flight Series) |year=2009 |pp=168 |publisher=Texas A & M University Press |oclc=680622488 |isbn=9781603443609 |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jQDK95Y?url=https://www.worldcat.org/title/red-cosmos-ke-tsiolkovskii-grandfather-of-soviet-rocketry/oclc/680622488 |archivedate=6 November 2018}} Vladimir Solovyov described his encounters with the entity ''Sophia'' in his works, such as ''Three Encounters'' and ''Lectures on Godmanhood''. His fusion was driven by the desire to reconcile or unite with Orthodox Christianity the various traditions by the Russian [[Slavophiles]]' concept of [[sobornost]]. His Russian religious philosophy had a very strong impact on the [[Russian Symbolism|Russian Symbolist]] art movements of his time. His teachings on ''Sophia'', conceived as the merciful unifying feminine wisdom of God comparable to the Hebrew [[Shekinah]] or various goddess traditions, have been deemed a [[heresy]] by [[Russian Orthodox Church Outside Russia]] and as unsound and unorthodox by the [[Patriarchate of Moscow]].{{cite web |url=http://ecumenizm.tripod.com/ECUMENIZM/id17.html |title=The Sophian heresy and attempts to feminize God |publisher=ecumenizm.tripod.com |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jQWHmoo?url=http://ecumenizm.tripod.com/ECUMENIZM/id17.html |archivedate=6 November 2018}} [[File:Volition-of-the-Cosmos.jpg |180 px |right |thumb |The cover of the book "The Will of the Universe; Unknown Intelligent Forces" by [[Konstantin Tsiolkovsky|Tsiolkovsky]], 1928]] [[Nikolai Fyodorovich Fyodorov|Nikolai Fyodorov]] was a [[Russian Orthodox Christian]] philosopher, who was part of the Russian cosmism movement and a precursor of [[transhumanism]]. Fedorov argued that humanity is the culmination of [[evolution]], as well as its creator and director. Humans must therefore direct evolution where their reason and morality dictate. Fedorov stated that the struggle against death can become the most natural cause uniting all people, regardless of their nationality, race, citizenship or wealth. He called this the ''Common Cause''. Fedorov thought that death and afterdeath existence should become the subject of comprehensive scientific inquiry, that achieving [[immortality]] and revival is the greatest goal of science.{{cite web |url=http://www.berdyaev.com/berdiaev/berd_lib/1915_186.html |author=[[Nikolai Berdyaev]] |title=The religion of resuscitative resurrection The "Philosophy of the Common Task" of N. F. Fedorov |publisher=berdyaev.com |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jQibnOC?url=http://www.berdyaev.com/berdiaev/berd_lib/1915_186.html |archivedate=6 November 2018}} At the beginning of the 20th century, there was a burst of scientific investigation into interplanetary travel, largely driven by the fiction writers such as [[Jules Verne]] and [[Herbert Wells]] as well as philosophical movements like [[Russian cosmism]]. In 1903, [[Konstantin Tsiolkovsky]] published the first serious scientific work on space travel. His work was essentially unknown outside the [[Russian Empire]], but inside the country it inspired further research, experimentation and the formation of the Society for Studies of [[Interplanetary spaceflight]].{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=k8CxJeFzCdQC&pg=PA26 |author=A. Bowdoin Van Riper |title=Rockets and Missiles: The Life Story of a Technology |date=29 October 2007 |publisher=[[JHU Press]] |isbn=978-0-8018-8792-5 |pages=26–28 |accessdate=13 October 2018}} Tsiolkovsky wrote a book called "The Will of the Universe; Unknown Intelligent Forces" in which he propounded a philosophy of [[panpsychism]]. He believed humans would eventually colonize the [[Milky Way]]. His thought preceded the Space Age by several decades, and some of what he foresaw in his imagination has come into being since his death. Tsiolkovsky did not believe in traditional religious cosmology, but instead he believed in a cosmic being that governed humans.{{cite book |url=https://www.prlib.ru/en/node/404538 |last=[[Konstantin Tsiolkovsky|Tsiolkovsky]] |first=Konstantin Eduardovich |title=The Will of the Universe; Unknown Intelligent Forces |place=[[Kaluga]] |publisher=The author's edition |year=1928 |pages=23 |language=Russian |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jR4GDrr?url=https://www.prlib.ru/en/node/404538 |archivedate=6 November 2018}} The ideas of the Russian philosophers and cossmists later were developed by those in the transhumanist movement and [[Rerikhism]].{{cite book |year=2013 |url=http://sovieteramuseum.com/?product=art-works-by-russian-cosmism-painter-xx-xxi-ct-catalogue-of-exhibition-2013 |title=Art works by Russian cosmism painter XX – XXI ct. Catalogue of exhibition 2013 |publisher=Roerich museum |accessdate=28 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6qGPQz1bk? |archivedate=6 May 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/work/conferencies/2003/index.php |title=International Scientific and Public Conference ”Cosmic World Outlook – New Mentality of the ХХI Century” |publisher=en.icr.su |accessdate=16 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ivdI4YXn?url=http://en.icr.su/work/conferencies/2003/index.php |archivedate=11 July 2016}} For example, the [[List of Russian scientists#Physicians and psychologists|Russian scientist]] [[Victor Skumin]] argues that the [[Victor Skumin#Culture of Health and other contributions|Culture of Health]] will play an important role in the creation of a human spiritual society into the [[Solar System]].{{cite book |last=[[Victor Skumin|Skumin]] |first=V. A. |script-title=ru: Культура здоровья — фундаментальная наука о человеке |trans-title=A Culture of Health as a fundamental human science |year=1995 |url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/3000010561594?query=%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%BA%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80+%D1%81%D0%BA%D1%83%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BD+ |language=Russian |isbn=5-88167-003-5 |accessdate=6 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73jRm9yyS?url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/3000010561594?query=виктор+скумин+ |archivedate=6 November 2018}}{{cite web |url=http://900igr.net/prezentatsii/fizkultura/Kultura-zdorovja/007-Kultura-zdorovja-fundamentalnaja-nauka-o-Dukhovnom-CHelovechestve.html |year=2009 |author=Kovaleva E. A. |title=Педагогический совет. Культура здоровья учащихся как фактор здоровьесберегающей среды школы. Слайд 7 |trans-title=Pedagogical Council. Slide 7 of the presentation "culture of health" to the lessons of physical education on the theme the "Health" |publisher=900igr.net |accessdate=28 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wH2YJ5wh? |archivedate=6 January 2018}} ==Historical development== [[File:Roerich memorial and house (17293917288).jpg |thumb |180 px |right |140th birth anniversary of [[Nicholas Roerich]].{{cite web |url=https://www.rbth.com/arts/2014/10/12/nicholas_roerichs_140th_birth_anniversary_celebrated_in_kullu_valley_38961 |title=Nicholas Roerich’s 140th birth anniversary celebrated in Kullu Valley |publisher=The Voice of Russia |date=12 October 2014 |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qrR7wJl?url=https://www.rbth.com/arts/2014/10/12/nicholas_roerichs_140th_birth_anniversary_celebrated_in_kullu_valley_38961 |archivedate=11 November 2018}} ]] [[File:Roerich-Museum-1929.jpg |thumb |upright |[[Master Building]] in [[NYC]], 1929 view.]] Information about [[Vedanta]] and [[Buddhism]] spread in [[Western countries]] in the first decade of the 20th century. In the United States of the 1920s, when the voises in religion were arguing over [[fundamentalism]] and [[modernism]] as the only available choice, and long before [[Shangri-La]] had become a popularly accepted myth, a vanguard movement was promoting the alternative of the wisdom of the [[Eastern world]].{{cite journal |author=Brian Taves |year=1985 |title=Philosophy Into Popular Fiction: Talbot Mundy and The Theosophical Society |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/41171147?seq=1#page_scan_tab_contents |journal=Southern California QuarterlyTo |volume=67 |issue=2 |pages=153-186 |doi=10.2307/41171147 |issn= |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qsRpCDp?url=http://scq.ucpress.edu/content/67/2/153 |archivedate=11 November 2018}} [[Theosophy (Blavatskian)|Theosophy]] proposed the existence of a society of Secret Chiefs called the [[Great White Brotherhood]]. The members of this Brotherhood, in belief systems akin to Theosophy and [[New Age]], are said to be perfected beings of great power who spread spiritual teachings through selected humans. The members of the Brotherhood may be known as the [[Masters of the Ancient Wisdom]] or the [[Ascended Masters]]. They are referred to by [[theosophist]]s as Elder Brothers of the human race, [[Adept]]s, [[Mahātmā]]s, or simply as the Masters. The first person to talk about them in the West was [[Helena Blavatsky]], after she and other people claimed to have received messages from them. These included [[Nicholas Roerich]] and [[Helena Roerich]], too.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=TI6fAwAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=The+myth+of+the+Masters+revived&hl=ru&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiY0bbboKTeAhWOhqYKHY0ABHMQ6AEIKzAA#v=onepage&q=The%20myth%20of%20the%20Masters%20revived&f=false |title=The myth of the Masters revived: The Occult Lives of Nikolai and Elena Roerich |publisher=books.google.ru |isbn=978-90-04-27043-5 |accessdate=26 October 2018}} She emphasized that knowledge was the leading path of all great Teachers. Knowledge will permit a free and vital approach to the great Teaching, as vitally real as is great Matter itself.{{cite book |url=https://www.smashwords.com/books/view/702099 |author=Helena Roerich |title=Foundations of Buddhism |publisher=Agni Yoga Society |year=2017 |isbn=9781946742353 |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qt2a8kH?url=https://www.smashwords.com/books/view/702099 |archivedate=11 November 2018}} When Nicholas Roerich passed away, his wife is believed to have carried on the work prescribed by Master Morya, “I exist only due to the ray of the Great Master, who said it was necessary for me to remain because no one could replace me as I worked under the highest Cosmic Sign, and this century was in need of my attainment”. The main aim of Helena Roerich was to spread the message of Agni Yoga.{{cite web |url=https://www.rbth.com/blogs/tatar_straits/2017/03/18/when-helena-roerich-called-kalimpong-home_721753 |title=When Helena Roerich called Kalimpong home |author=Ajay Kamalakaran |publisher=Russia beyond |date=18 March 2017 |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qtOgEyJ?url=https://www.rbth.com/blogs/tatar_straits/2017/03/18/when-helena-roerich-called-kalimpong-home_721753 |archivedate=11 November 2018}} ===The Agni Yoga Society in the State of New York=== The Agni Yoga Society was founded in 1920 by Helena and Nicholas Roerich. It is a non-profit educational institution incor|porated in 1946 under the laws of the [[State of New York]], and is supported entirely by voluntary contributions and membership dues. The organization was located in the building ''[[Master Apartments]]''. The aims of the Society are embodied in the philosophy that gives it its name—Agni Yoga—as contained in the books of the Agni Yoga Series published by the Society. In them is found a synthesis of ancient Eastern beliefs and modern Western thought and a bridge between the spiritual and the scientific.{{cite web| url=http://www.agniyoga.us/ |title=AGNI YOGA (Sacred Heart Fire) AGNI YOGA The Great Synthesis |publisher=agniyoga.us |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qtsQePo?url=http://www.agniyoga.us/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Unlike previous [[yoga]]s, Agni Yoga is a path of practice in daily life. It is the yoga of fiery energy, of consciousness, of responsible, directed thought. It teaches that the evolution of the planetary consciousness is a pressing necessity and that, through individual striving, it is an attainable aspiration for mankind. Though not systematized in an ordinary sense, it is a teaching that helps the student to discover moral and spiritual guide-posts by which to learn to govern his or her life and thus contribute to the [[common good]]. For this reason Agni Yoga has been called a ''Living ethic''. Speaking about the role of [[personality]] in the [[spiritual evolution]] of mankind, [[Helena Roerich]] wrote,{{cite web| url=http://www.aquaac.org/un/elttrs/201003.html |title=The Spiritual Work of the United Nations and the Liberation of Humanity Creating Fundamental Global Transformations through the Power of Thought |publisher=aquaac.org |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qu54znq?url=http://www.aquaac.org/un/elttrs/201003.html |archivedate=11 November 2018}}{{cite web| url=http://www.agniyoga.org/ay_en/Letters-of-Helena-Roerich-II.php |title=Letters of Helena Roerich II, 25 October 1936 |publisher=agniyoga.org |accessdate=25 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6p2OJSzbs?url=http://www.agniyoga.org/ay_en/Letters-of-Helena-Roerich-II.php |archivedate=17 March 2017}} {{quote|'' The greatest benefit that we can contribute consists in the broadening of consciousness, and the improvement and enrichment of our thinking, together with the purification of the heart, in order to strengthen our emanations; and by thus raising our vibrations, we restore the health of all that surrounds us. True, it is impossible to increase our store of psychic energy without the help of the Teacher; however if our hearts are open and purified, and if our organism permits it, the Teacher will not tarry in manifesting himself''.}} ===Latvian Roerich Society in Riga=== The [[Latvia]]n Roerich Society is one of the oldest society established by the Roerichs family. In 1920 Vladimir Schibayev, while being in [[London]], met Nicholas and Helena Roerichs. In [[Riga]] they created a group of people to study Agni Yoga and another theosophical literature. In 1928, Schibayev went to [[India]], to become the secretary of Roerich.{{cite web |url=http://www.latvijasrerihabiedriba.lv/images/RXLVang.htm |title=In short about Latvian Roerich Society |publisher=latvijasrerihabiedriba |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73quP4eRE?url=http://www.latvijasrerihabiedriba.lv/images/RXLVang.htm |archivedate=11 November 2018}} In Riga the place of the leader of Latvian Roerich Society was taken by [[Doctor (title)|doctor]]-[[Homeopathy|homeopath]] [[:lv:Fēlikss Lūkins|Felix Lukin.]] [[Dr.]] Felix Lukin and his son Dr. [[:lv:Haralds Lūkins|Harald Lukin]] conducted [[clinical trials]] are many natural [[medication]]s that they received from [[Svetoslav Roerich]] of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati''.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xB-0B1OWsbIC&pg=PA144&lpg=PA144&dq=Feliks+Lukin&source=bl&ots=9sr1G3-LjI&sig=BOFxH1ypWEF0Mff4E_p4yCgnFWc&hl=ru&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwikrLTm8JbeAhUFposKHVn1DlA4ChDoATAFegQIBBAB#v=onepage&q=Feliks%20Lukin&f=false |title=History and status of homoeopathy around the world |author=Aswarda Das |publisher=books.google.com |isbn=81-8056-573-4 |year=2005 |pages=144-147 |accessdate=21 October 2018}} In 1936 [[:lv:Rihards Rudzītis|Rihard Rudzitis]] officially became the president of the Latvian Society. During his lead, the books of Living Ethics, the works by the Roerichs, [[Helena Blavatsky]]’s and works by Rudzitis himself were published. In 1937 the first conference of [[Baltic states|Baltic]] Roerich Societies took place. The Latvian Society was renewed at the [[Soviet Union]] in 1988. Dr. Harald Lukin carried the Roerichs [[Banner of Peace]]. The new president Gunta Rudzite, the daughter of Rihard Rudzitis, held contacts with many people of the republics in the [[USSR]] who were interested in the ideas of Agni Yoga. On 2005 the Roerich Society received a social beneficial status in the [[Republic of Latvia]]. ===Master Institute of United Arts in New York City=== Nicolas Roerich is known as a thinker and a builder of life. His art and writings are an evocation to Beauty, to Knowledge, and to Culture. His vision is nicely captured in his philosophical statement of the Master Institute of United Arts which he formed in [[New York City]] in 1921:{{cite web |url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/2017/07/12/nicholas-roerichs-symbolic-journey/ |title=Inspired By Art: Nicholas Roerich’s Symbolic Journey |publisher=philosophicalsociety.org |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qumopSR?url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/2017/07/12/nicholas-roerichs-symbolic-journey/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} {{quote|''Art will unify all humanity. Art is one – indivisible. Art has its many branches, yet all are one. Art is the manifestation of the coming synthesis. Art is for all''.}} Mr. and Mrs. Horch financed and directed the Master Institute that taught the fine and dramatic arts. For much of its existence, the Master Institute was housed in the [[Master Apartments]], designed by Harvery Wiley Corbett in 1929 for Roerich and built on the site of the former Horch mansion at 310 Riverside Dr. in New York City.{{cite web |url=http://www.columbia.edu/cu/lweb/archival/collections/ldpd_6636038/ |title=Louis L. and Nettie S. Horch Papers, 1920s-1960s |publisher=columbia.edu |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qvS9UnN?url=http://www.columbia.edu/cu/lweb/archival/collections/ldpd_6636038/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Roerich planned to realize the educational concepts at the Institute. He invited as teachers such famous people as [[George Bellows]], [[Claude Fayette Bragdon]], [[Norman Bel Geddes]], [[Stark Young]], [[Deems Taylor]], [[Robert Edmond Jones]], and [[Lee Simonson]].{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich.org/roerich-biography.php |title=Nicholas Roerich Biography America |publisher=Nicholas Roerich Museum New York |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qvhsopy?url=http://www.roerich.org/roerich-biography.php |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Intensive work was in process under direct supervision of Roerich. Nicholas gave lectures, organized new classes, for example classes of music and sculpture for the blind. Many representatives of American science and culture expressed their willingness to educate students according with the proposed curriculum. There were [[Felix Salmond]], [[Ernest Bloch]], and [[Michael Fokin]]. In the ''Institute of United Arts in New York City'' also taught [[Rockwell Kent]], [[Claude Bragdon]], [[George Bellows]], and [[Norman Bel Geddes]].{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-13.htm |author=O. A. Cherkasova|title=N. K. Roerich and America |publisher=Nicholas Roerich Estate Museum in [[:ru:Извара (Волосовский район)|Izvara]] ([[Leningrad Region]]) |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qvwTzjw?url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-13.htm |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Some contemporaries were skeptical spiritual mission of Nicholas Roerich. But those who embraced his philosophy experienced something transformative in his canvases. Roerich's name is universally known not only as Master of the brush but also as a thinker and a builder of life. The works of the Artist are an evocation to Beauty, to Knowledge, and to Culture.{{cite web |url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/tag/master-institute-of-united-arts/ |title=Tag Archives: Master Institute of United Arts |publisher=The Masonic Philosophical Society |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qwQmTGL?url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/tag/master-institute-of-united-arts/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} ===Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' in India=== [[File:Urusvati base.jpg |thumb |240px |left |Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' in [[Naggar]] ([[Himachal Pradesh]], [[India]]).{{cite web |url=https://www.rbth.com/articles/2012/05/02/nicholas_roerichs_legacy_lives_on_in_himalayan_hamlet_15652 |author=Ajay Kamalakaran |title=Nicholas Roerich’s legacy lives on in Himalayan Hamlet |publisher=rbth.com |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qwnrgWC?url=https://www.rbth.com/articles/2012/05/02/nicholas_roerichs_legacy_lives_on_in_himalayan_hamlet_15652 |archivedate=11 November 2018}}]] Roerich's family moved to [[India]] in December 1923. They settled in [[Darjeeling]], a town in the [[India]]n [[States and union territories of India|state]] of [[West Bengal]]. It is located in the [[Lower Himalayan Range]]s at an elevation of {{convert|6700|ft|1|abbr=on}}.{{cite web |url=http://ignca.gov.in/roerich-himalayan-museum-of-folk-and-tribal-art/ |title=Roerich Himalayan Museum Of Folk And Tribal Art |publisher=ignca.gov.in |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qx6ANWT?url=http://ignca.gov.in/roerich-himalayan-museum-of-folk-and-tribal-art/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} From 1925 to 1928, Roerichs took part in a [[Central Asia]] expedition, that traveled through hard-to-reach and little-investigated regions of [[India]], [[China]], [[Soviet Union]], [[Mongolia]] and [[Tibet]]. [[Sikkim]] was the starting point of the expedition. During the expedition, research in topics such as [[history]], [[archeology]], [[ethnography]], [[history of philosophy]], [[arts]] and [[religions]], and [[geography]] was conducted. Rare manuscripts were found, and rich linguistic materials were collected. Special attention was paid to the problem of historical unity of cultures of various peoples. In 1925, Helena Roerich began to translate an extensive selection from ''[[The Mahatma Letters to A.P. Sinnett]]''. She also wrote a book named "Chalice of the East", which was published under the pen name "Iskander Khanum". Helena Roerich's manuscript "Foundations of Buddhism" was published in 1926, at [[Ulaanbaatar|Urga]], where her expedition was staying at the time. In this book, the fundamental philosophical notions of Buddha's Teaching were interpreted.{{cite web |url=http://www.found-helenaroerich.ru/eng/biography/ |title=Helena I. Roerich (1879-1955) philosopher, writer, spouse of Nicholas Roerich |publisher=found-helenaroerich.ru |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j19KaUR8?url=http://www.found-helenaroerich.ru/eng/biography/ |archivedate=15 July 2016}} [[File:Юрий Рерих.jpg |thumb |180px |Prof. [[George de Roerich]], director of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati''.{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-18.htm |title=N.K. Roerich and America |publisher=roerich-izvara.ru |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qycOJHd?url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-18.htm |archivedate=11 November 2018}}
The subtitle beneath the first picture: ''George Roerich – director of «Urusvati» Institute. Courtesy of N. Roerich Museum, New York''.]] The plethora of materials collected during the Central Asia Expedition became the foundation for the establishment of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' in [[Darjeeling]] in 1928. A few months later the institute moved to [[Naggar]] in [[Kulu Valley]].{{cite web |url=https://www.alamy.com/nagar-himachal-pradesh-india-interior-of-the-roerich-estate-museum-where-the-russian-artist-philosopher-and-traveller-nicholas-roerich-settled-i-image183921077.html |title=Nagar, Himachal Pradesh, India : Interior of the Roerich Estate museum, where the Russian artist, philosopher and traveller Nicholas Roerich settled |publisher=alamy.com |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qyyMq3k?url=https://www.alamy.com/nagar-himachal-pradesh-india-interior-of-the-roerich-estate-museum-where-the-russian-artist-philosopher-and-traveller-nicholas-roerich-settled-i-image183921077.html |archivedate=11 November 2018}} The center engaged in scientific exchange with 285 institutes, universities, museums, and libraries around the world. [[George de Roerich]] was a world-renowned scientist, [[Oriental studies|orientalist]], and [[guru]].{{cite journal |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/j9.html |title=Удрая – наш Духовный Наставник |trans-title=Udraia (George Roerich's spiritual name) is our Guru |author=[[Victor Skumin|Skumin VA]] |year=2003 |journal=To Health via Culture |volume=9 |pages=3–12 |issn=0204-3440 |accessdate=14 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmc0Rh13?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/j9.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}} His monumental translation of the ''[[Blue Annals]]'' ({{bo|t=དེབ་ཐེར་སྔོན་པོ}}),{{cite web |url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=2R6OaXn76IgC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false |author=[[George de Roerich|George N. Roerich]] |title=The Blue Annals Parts 1-2 |publisher=books.google.ru |pages=1141 |isbn=9788120804715 |accessdate=25 October 2018}} and his 11-volume ''[[Tibetic languages|Tibetan]]-Russian-English dictionary with [[Sanskrit]] parallels'' were published in 1934.{{cite web |url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/2000054567489?query=Tibetan-Russian-English+dictionary+ |title=The Tibetan-Russian-English dictionary with Sanskrit parallels |publisher=The European Library |accessdate=14 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6l9v7whq3?url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/2000054567489?query=Tibetan-Russian-English+dictionary+ |archivedate=10 October 2016 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}} One of his main focuses for the center was to bring people to the Institute who practiced and lived the cultures being examined by the center. George Roerich was the director of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' for 10 years.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/family/gnr/02.php |title=George Roerich /Yuri Nikolayevich Roerich (1902 – 1960) |publisher=en.icr.su |accessdate=14 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6l9vt9Cqs?url=http://en.icr.su/family/gnr/02.php |archivedate=10 October 2016}} [[File:S.Roerich Stamp.jpg |left |245px |thumb |[[Svetoslav Roerich]]. Russian postage stamp]] [[Svetoslav Roerich]] was in charge of the work of the Natural Sciences Department. He carried out unique researches in various fields of the [[natural sciences]]. At the basis of his scientific investigations was understanding of nature as one whole that is inalienably connected with the cosmic laws. The scope of his interests: [[cultural studies]], comparative religious studies and [[philosophy]], [[botany]], [[mineralogy]], tibetan [[pharmacopoeia]], [[chemistry]] and its [[alchemical]] sources.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/family/snr/02.php |title=Svetoslav Nikolayevich Roerich (1904-1993) |publisher=en.icr.su |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73vcDuO2o?url=http://en.icr.su/family/snr/02.php |archivedate=14 November 2018 |accessdate=14 November 2018}} The work of the Himalayan Research Institute was based on wide international cooperation.{{cite journal |last=[[:cv:Ауновская Ольга Константиновна|Aunovska]] |first=Olga |date=1985 |title=Seeds of fraternity |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/articles/ukr485.html |journal=Ukraine |volume=4 |pages=14-15| accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6q87yYhVB?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/articles/ukr485.html |archivedate=1 May 2017}} Major [[scientist]]s and cultural workers collaborated with the Institute Urusvati. Such as Soviet academician [[Nikolai Vavilov]], biologist and biophysicist [[Jagadish Chandra Bose]], [[Bengalis|Bengali]] [[polymath]] [[Rabindranath Tagore]], the father of Indian journalism [[Ramananda Chatterjee]], Indian [[philosopher]] and [[Politician|statesman]] [[Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan]], Swedish geographer and explorer [[Sven Hedin]], and many others.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/evolution/urusvati/03.php |title=The Light of the Morning Star |publisher=International Centre of the Roerichs |accessdate=14 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73vcVmjRJ?url=http://en.icr.su/evolution/urusvati/03.php |archivedate=14 November 2018}} ''The Journal of the Urusvati Himalayan Research Institute (U.J.)'' published articles on various aspects of science and culture. The publications presented a multi-level perception of the authors who were looking for a new integration of different cultural models in the mainstream of Agni Yoga.{{cite web |url=https://books.google.ru/books/about/Journal_Of_Urusvati_Himalayan_Research_I.html?id=yBO3pmzzhWkC&redir_esc=y |title=Journal Of Urusvati Himalayan Research Institute, Volumes 1-3 |publisher=books.google.ru |accessdate=24 September 2018 |isbn=9788179360118}} ===Nicholas Roerich Museum in New York City=== [[File:WTM3 The Fixers 0015.jpg |180px |thumb |right |[[Nicholas Roerich Museum, New York City]]]] {{Main|Nicholas Roerich Museum, New York City}} The Nicholas Roerich Museum in New York City was originally located in the Master Apartments at 103rd Street and [[Riverside Drive (Manhattan)]], which were built especially for Roerich in 1929. Now the museum is located in a brownstone at 319 West 107th Street on Manhattan's Upper West Side. This Museum is one of the most off-the-beaten-path of Manhattan's museums, a collection of works by Nicolas Roerich, who lived on the Upper West Side for a time in the 1920's. The brownstone is chock-full of amazing natural scenes from the Himalayas, where this artist spent two decades of his life. Roerich usually painted in stark tempera, with blazing orange skies or impossibly deep blue mountains.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/16/travel/journeys-specialty-museums-finding-art-not-crowds-in-new-york.html |date=16 April 2006 |author=Seth Kugel |title=JOURNEYS: SPECIALTY MUSEUMS; Finding Art, Not Crowds, in New York. The Himalayan Upper West Side |publisher=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=12 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j1lZb6Mo?url=http://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/16/travel/journeys-specialty-museums-finding-art-not-crowds-in-new-york.html?_r=0 |archivedate=15 July 2016}} Currently, the museum includes between 100 and 200 of Roerich's works as well as a collection of archival materials and still attracts pilgrims from throughout the world. The mission of the Nicholas Roerich Museum is one: to make available to the public the full range of Roerich’s accomplishments. They cover the realms of art, science, spirituality, peacemaking, and more.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=I5Kyo03NxncC&pg=PA86&dq=%22Nicholas+Roerich+Museum%22&ei=CfWySJWGBIyuyAT-uKz-Bg&sig=ACfU3U1VaGGP0xsNuixcSHcUcdMEJCcA3g |title=Spiritual Places| last=Squires| first=Emily| authorlink=Emily Squires |author2=Len Belzer |year=2000| pages=86 |publisher=Cosimo, Inc. |isbn=1931044031 |accessdate=17 September 2018}} The Museum seeks to realize the ideas of Agni Yoga on the role of culture in the evolution of the world and evolution of the human consciousness. Information about these Roerich's ideas is always available. The museum also provides an opportunity for young musicians to perform in front of an audience on a voluntary and free basis.{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich.org/museum-about.php?mid=about_en |title=Nicholas Roerich Museum New York |publisher=roerich.org |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j1nfmzWO?url=http://www.roerich.org/museum-about.php |archivedate=15 July 2016}} The Nicholas Roerich Museum in New York is the largest center of Roerich-related activity outside of [[Russian Federation]].{{cite web |url=http://www.isfp.co.uk/russian_thinkers/nikolay_roerich.html |title=Nikolay Roerich |publisher=isfp.co.uk |accessdate=14 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6p5R60yV5?url=http://www.isfp.co.uk/russian_thinkers/nikolay_roerich.html |archivedate=19 March 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} ===International Non-governmental Organisation "The International Centre of the Roerichs"=== [[File:Зал Музея Рериха в Москве. 2014.JPG |thumb |240px |left |[[:ru:Международный центр Рерихов|International Center of the Roerichs]] (The hall of ''Living Ethics'') in 2014.]] ''The International Center of the Roerichs'' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: ''Междунаро́дный це́нтр Ре́рихов'') is a non-governmental public association of citizens and public associations incorporated on the basis of their common interests in the cause of study, preservation, and popularization of the Roerich family heritage. The Center is an associated member of the [[Non-Governmental Organization]]s Association under the [[United Nations Department of Public Information]]. Conducting its activities, this International public organization proceeds from the applicable the law of the states in which its structural divisions are acting, the [[United Nations Charter]], norms of the [[International law]] and International legal acts related to the Center’s sphere of activity.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/about/statute/ |title=Extract from the Charter of the International public organization "International Center of the Roerichs" |publisher=en.icr.su |accessdate=17 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6pmrlZBwD?url=http://en.icr.su/about/statute/ |archivedate=17 April 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}} ''Museum named after Nicholas Roerich'' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: ''Музе́й и́мени Н. К. Ре́риха Междунаро́дного це́нтра Ре́рихов'') contents comprises the Roerichs' cultural heritage passed on to the Soviet Roerichs' Foundation (now International Center of the Roerichs) by [[Svetoslav Roerich]] in 1990. It carries in itself a new cosmic world view for which new interest grows more each year. The core of the Rerikhism is the philosophy of cosmic reality – the Agni Yoga, which develops the idea of a close relationship between man and [[Cosmos]], contains knowledge which assists in understanding the specific features peculiar to the new evolutionary stage of mankind's development.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/museum/ |title=The Nicholas Roerich Museum |accessdate=17 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6pms1o0eG?url=http://en.icr.su/museum/ |publisher=en.icr.su |archivedate=17 April 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} ===The World Organisation of Culture of Health=== [[File:Victor Skumin 1997 Sikkim.jpg |thumb |220px |right |Prof. [[Victor Skumin]], president-founder of the WOCH.]] [[File:Victor Skumin 1995 Nepal.jpg |thumb |220px |right |The Board of the International Buddhist Meditation Centre]] ''The World Organisation of Culture of Health ('''WOCH''')'' — International [[Social movement organization|social movement]] ''To Health via Culture'' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: Междунаро́дное обще́ственное Движе́ние «К Здоро́вью че́рез Культу́ру») was founded in the year 1994. [[Victor Skumin]] was elected to the post of the President-founder of this organisation. The WOCH operates in accordance with the registered in [[Ministry of Justice (Russia)|Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation]] Charter.{{cite web |url=http://kult-zdor.ru/?page_id=824 |title=Charter of the World Organisation of Culture of Health (Russian: Устав) |publisher=Kult-zdor.ru |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6poMifaLN?url=http://kult-zdor.ru/?page_id=824 |archivedate=18 April 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} In Agni Yoga much attention is paid to health. So in the book ''Supermundane'' (paragraph 525) recorded the words of [[Morya (Theosophy)|Master Morya]], addressed to Urusvati,{{cite web |url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Supermundane.php |title=Supermundane, 525 |publisher=agniyoga.org |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ATQDcyS?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Supermundane.php |archivedate=14 October 2018}} {{quote|''Urusvati knows that people are responsible for three aspects of health. First, their own health; second, the health of the planet; and finally, the health of the Supermundane World... People must safeguard their own health, not only for themselves but also for those around them. The human organism, though seemingly small, is a powerful repository of energy, and truly dominates its earthly environment''.}} It is from these positions that WOCH approaches the solution of problems related to health.{{cite web |url= http://kult-zdor.ru/?page_id=5 |author=Victor A. Skumin |title=Culture of health is a science of future |publisher=The World Organisation of Culture of Health |accessdate=10 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wFXbtCDp |archivedate=5 January 2018}} As ''Holy Scripture of Agni Yoga'' says, physicians can be true helpers of humanity in the ascent of the spirit. The intellect of a physician must be reinforced by his heart. The physician must be a psychologist, and he must not ignore the wondrous psychic energy.{{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Aum.php |title=Aum, §3 |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1936 |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ASzqsWl |archivedate=14 October 2018}} Prof. Verhorubova and Prof. Lobanova from [[Tomsk State Pedagogical University]] argued (2012) that in accordance with the concept of a culture of health, proposed by [[Victor Skumin|Skumin]], the culture – spiritual, mental, and physical – determines the status of human health. And health – spiritual, mental, physical – is a prerequisite for achieving a higher level of culture.{{cite journal |url= http://cyberleninka.ru/article/n/mnogoobrazie-opredeleniy-fenomena-kultura-zdorovya-kak-pokazatel-ego-mnogogrannosti-v-pedagogicheskom-obrazovanii |last2=Lobanova |first2=N.A. |last1= Verhorubova |first1=O.V. |title= Многообразие определений феномена "культура здоровья" как показатель его многогранности в педагогическом образовании |trans-title=The diversity of definitions the phenomenon of "culture of health" as an indicator of its versatility in education |journal=Вестник Томского государственного педагогического университета |year=2012 |issue=5 |pages=161–5 |accessdate=10 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6cKKxNxWb |archivedate=16 October 2015}} The World Organisation of Culture of Health, in order to promote international relations, has established a link with the International Buddhist Meditation Centre.{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/ibmcnepal/videos/vb.242290825944809/670365706470650/?type=2&theater] |title=International Buddhist Meditation Centre |publisher=facebook.com |accessdate=20 September 2018}} The [[anthem]] of WOCH (''To Health via Culture'') consists of four [[stanzas]]. The capital letters each of the four stanzas form the word [[Agni]].{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=Victor |script-title=ru: Молитвы, гимны, притчи Культуры Здоровья |trans-title=Culture of Health: prayers, hymns, parables |year=2002 |location=[[Cheboksary]] |publisher=To Health via Culture |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/m.html |language=Russian |isbn=5-88167-018-3 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmcES03C?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/m.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=Victor |script-title=ru: Гимны Культуры Здоровья |trans-title=Gimns of Culture of Health |year=2007 |location=[[Cheboksary]] |publisher=To Health via Culture |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/gimn.html |language=Russian |isbn=978-5-88167-030-6 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmcoqT4R?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/gimn.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} ({{YouTube|kyknqmZhyIk|''Anthem "To Health via Culture."''}}). Another anthem by [[Victor Skumin#Literary and publishing activities|Skumin]] is termed "Urusvati". [[Helena Roerich]], known as the ''[[Tara (Buddhism)|Tara]] Urusvati'' in Agni Yoga and [[Rerikhism]]. This anthem begins with the phrase, "The fire of the heart ignites Urusvati, she teaches the spirit take-off on the wings of the grace". Six more [[hymn]]s have the names: "Heart", "Shambhala", "Morya", "Ur", "Agni", and "Sun".
